name: Aurora Ozone Hotel

reviews.title: Loved the pelicans
reviews.text: This hotel was booked for us by our relatives so we did not know what to expect but were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed our stay. The rooms were pretty standard...and a little old fashioned..but we were comfortable, had our own fridge and a serviceable bathroom. Fresh milk and cookies were supplied every day so we could make our own coffee and tea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel directly faces the sea as the name suggests and is near the Kingscote Pier where there is a small and quirky aquarium with some wonderful seahorses. Just off the pier, the aquarium owner feeds pelicans every afternoon at 5pm and you can watch for free while he gives a lecture about the birds. In the evening he organizes walks along the beach to view the Little or Fairy Penguin.
reviews.title: Didn't work for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are pleasant, their is a nice lounge overlooking the sea, and the restaurant is marvellous. Every evening they do a roast of the day served buffet style for such a reasonable price, you can't turn it down. There are some wonderful a la carte items available as well. The buffet breakfast is also reasonably priced and delicious.
reviews.title: Good Location
Nice place
reviews.text: kangaroo Island is very rural and mostly National Park so there are no ritzy developments here....just a wonderful opportunity to see wildlife and some fabulous scenery.

We stayed here as part of an APT tour of Kangaroo Island, and I have to say it was the low point of our tour. The hotel is in two parts across the road from each other, and they couldn't contrast more. There's a historic, but VERY shabby, hotel on one side, and a very, very new modern part on the other side. We were put in the modern part, and our room seemed to be so new that we may well have been the first people to stay there. Which might explain why it was so completely and utterly soul-less. A plasma TV seems unnecessary after a few days looking at the spectacular scenery and wildlife of Kangaroo Island.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: Only got to spend a night here, but found the staff helpful and the room clean and well equipped. Hope to visit once again (but not on New Year's Eve & Day).
reviews.title: By the Sea, By the Sea
The Ozone Is a Most Refreshing Place to Stay!
reviews.text: We spent two delightful nights at the Ozone Hotel during a 3-day, 4wd tour of Kangaroo Island (which also was terrific and the highlight of our 2-week stay in "Oz"). The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. The ambiance fits in perfectly with the Island, sort of rustic but very clean and fully equipped with all hotel room needs (I found it amusing that their 115v. transformer in the bathroom for electric shavers worked, while those in some 4-star hotels in the big cities didn't). The restaurant food and prices are good and many of the islanders eat there, adding a lot to the experience.

reviews.title: Amazing Island, OK Hotel
reviews.text: While Kangaroo Island was the highlight of our trip to Australia, this hotel is your basic motel-style lodging. Rooms are reasonable size and non-descript, what you would expect at a motel chain. The restaurant is run strangely: you order at the counter and they announce your order number over the loudspeakers as each course is ready and you go pick up your food. The hotel has a pool, bar, keno and slot machines. The best things about the hotel are that is across the street from the ocean and a 1 minute walk from the fairy penguin tour, which is incredible.

description: Our Kangaroo Island Hotel, Aurora Ozone, is located on the beautiful foreshore at Kingscote. The original section of the hotel has a Victorian façade and has amenities that blend with the refined atmosphere of old world charm. Coupled with the vibrant & attractive new accommodation section, Aurora Ozone Hotel in Kangaroo Island has been developed to international standards and has become a flagship in hospitality
